This is a very Power specific directory name. Should we instead have a "host firmware" name for the dump folder?
We can have IBM specific names in this file right? this gets installed only on IBM systems
Can you please add information to the commit message on why you are removing these.
Move this as part of openpower-dump.bbclass
Hostboot dump is enabled for only selected openpower systems. Need recipie updates related to this. Here libekb-p10 is only good for selected systems , not supported all the phal.

I am little confused here, 
Seeing two option enable something for IBM p10 system. which one need to use 
1. _ibm-power10-cpu
2. _p10bmc

@brad Can you clarify like which one need to use or both are different purpose?

I think before enabling "openpower_dump_collection" you need to check phal feature is enabled or not. If not you can not enable since you have phal dependency. 
E.g
```
PACKAGECONFIG_append_p10bmc += " ${@bb.utils.contains('OBMC_MACHINE_FEATURES', 'phal', 'openpower_dump_collection', '', d)}"
```
Note: phal is used as machine specific feature and it can enable in required machine by using OBMC_MACHINE_FEATURES.
Please add related service file path link if it is new.
Please follow either lowercase letter or uppercase letter to make consistent.

Why do you required inherit (or bbclass), I think bbclass we will use for some python function (which can use more than one recipes) to implement. 
Please refer here to get more details. https://www.yoctoproject.org/docs/2.4.2/ref-manual/ref-manual.html#recipe-syntax
But, It necessary to use inc file to add some common variables and still we can use bbclass. I am not sure what is openBMC direction on this, @brad do you have any thoughts?
yes here we have a common variable across the recipes

All those dependency required for "enable-dump-collection" feature flag ?
If so, you can move those dependency list into "PACKAGECONFIG" (LN: 60) as third argument.
Please refer to get more details. https://www.yoctoproject.org/docs/2.4.2/ref-manual/ref-manual.html#var-PACKAGECONFIG
You can move this into after LN33.

Is it required for "enable-dump-collection" feature flag ?
If so, you can move this into "PACKAGECONFIG" (LN: 60) as a first argument.

Looks by default you are enabling it should be empty. Please check this. 
```
Setting a weak default value (??=)

It is possible to use a "weaker" assignment than in the previous section by using the "??=" operator. This assignment behaves identical to "?=" except that the assignment is made at the end of the parsing process rather than immediately. Consequently, when multiple "??=" assignments exist, the last one is used. Also, any "=" or "?=" assignment will override the value set with "??=". Here is an example:

     A ??= "somevalue"
     A ??= "someothervalue"
                
If A is set before the above statements are parsed, the variable retains its value. If A is not set, the variable is set to "someothervalue".

Again, this assignment is a "lazy" or "weak" assignment because it does not occur until the end of the parsing process.
```

In this patch, you are using few feature flag and build config parameters from few repository. If so, please add related review link so, that we can refer.

Other option, You can use Gerrit topic to group all related patches.
added review links to service files

- You are using "_append" so, no need of "+=".
- You need to enable only for rainier ? In early patch you enabled for all p10 systems.
Removed +=, it is enabled for all 10 sytsems
Is it used based on feature flag If so, please change like as suggested for other feature flag in this patch.
Is it used based on feature flag If so, please change like as suggested for other feature flag in this patch.
what is the ipl dependency here?

LN 46 and 48 is also controlled by feature flag ? If so, please correct it Else build may fail if not enabled. Or is it building without this service file If feature is disabled?
Please add review link for service file in commit message so, that reviewer can look that as well like how it get installed.
yes this needs to be controlled by service flag, adding all in one topic

I think you can do further optimisation as per previous comments.

- Remove From LN22 to LN28 and LN34
- Replace by below instead LN58 to LN62.
```
OPENPOWER_DUMP_DEPENDS = "phosphor-dbus-interfaces \
                          pdbg \
                          pdata \
                          ipl \
                         "

PACKAGECONFIG[openpower_dump_collection] = " \
        --enable-dump-collection \
        HB_DUMP_COLLECTION_PATH=${HB_DUMP_TMP_PATH}, \
        --disable-dump-collection, \
        ${OPENPOWER_DUMP_DEPENDS}, \
        "
```
Sorry for confusion but added a -1 to indicate working on fixing it by full build
I made comments about this in a later commit in the sequence.
This is added for building SDK, fixed the syntax
Any reason you changed this from a +=?
